MenuActionManager()

Initializes a new instance of the MenuActionManager class and all it's properties.

public MenuActionManager()

Remarks

Sets Service to newly created MenuActionService object and SelectedItem to 2 ("DisplayMainMenu" menu action).

BaseManager<T, TService>
IMenuAction

EnterOrEsc()

Asks user whether he/she wants to go back to main menu or exit the program completely. If user presses Esc "Exit" menu action is selected. If user presses Enter (or anything else, other that Esc ), "DisplayMainMenu" menu action is selected.

public void EnterOrEsc()
See Also
IMenuActionService
IManager<T, TService>

BaseManager<T, TService>
IMenuAction

GetFilteredList(int)

Gets menu actions that belong to specified menu.

protected override List<IMenuAction> GetFilteredList(int connectedItemId = 0)

Parameters

connectedItemId int

The value of this parameter doesn't matter in this implementation. It has set default value, so it can be omitted all together.

Returns

List<IMenuAction>

List of menu action objects with Menu value equal NextMenu value of currently selected item or Main if no object is currently selected.

IMenuAction

Select()

Selects menu action.

public IMenuAction? Select()

Returns

IMenuAction

Selected menu action or null if user failed to select existing action.

Remarks

Displays appropriate menu (elements of collection with Menu value equal selected item's NextMenu value. Asks user to select one element and sets it as selected item.
